title: C Spire contractor accidentally fires gun inside headquarters
content:
RIDGELAND, MS (Mississippi News Now) -
A man has been shot in the leg during an accidental shooting at the C Spire building in Ridgeland.
Lt. Brian Myers with Ridgeland Police says that one person shot himself in the leg and was transported to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
According to company spokesman, Dave Miller, a C Spire contractor suffered a leg wound when a gun he was carrying accidentally discharged in a third-floor restroom at C Spire’s corporate headquarters in Ridgeland.
Ridgeland Fire Department medics responded immediately along with the Ridgeland Police Department and treated the victim before transporting him to the hospital by ambulance.
The wound is not considered life-threatening.
The shooting was accidental and no one else was injured.
The incident is under investigation by the Ridgeland Police Department.
"While it appears the individual had a permit to carry the weapon, it is a violation of company and building rules to possess a firearm on any C Spire premises, including any parking lot or facility," said Miller. "The rules are designed to protect our employees, customers and visitors."
